item.title: Comment: Arts Council cuts
item.description: Writing for The Conversation, Dr Adam Behr discusses the problem of levelling up with culture.

item.title: Pioneering Newcastle University academic receives coveted award
item.description: Dr Mariam Rezaei has been awarded a Paul Hamlyn Foundation ‘Awards for Artists’ prize in recognition of her contribution to the field of music composition.

item.title: Climate change strikes: lightning patterns change with global warming
item.description: New research has shown climate change could alter lightning patterns across Europe.

item.title: Newcastle-led project helps save Hadrian’s Wall
item.description: Work by volunteers and experts at Newcastle University has helped save parts of Hadrian’s Wall for future generations.

item.title: Exhibition gives women shunned in ancient Greece a voice
item.description: Women shunned by society in ancient Greece will take centre stage in a new exhibition at the Great North Museum: Hancock.

item.title: Gastroenterology and hepatology research ranked as top ten
item.description: The US News Best Global Universities listing has placed Gastroenterology & Hepatology research at Newcastle University as top 10 in its 2022-23 rankings.

item.title: Comment: Burglars steal more gold when price is high – new research
item.description: Writing for The Conversation, Professor Nils Braakmann and colleagues discuss how the price of gold affects the rate of burglary in England and Wales.

item.title: Comment: Should lab-grown brain cells have legal rights?
item.description: Writing for The Conversation, Dr Josh Jowitt discusses whether lab-grown brain cells that can play pong should have legal rights.

item.title: More Covid-19 deaths globally in areas of high deprivation
item.description: Mortality rates of Covid-19 across the globe were higher in areas of socioeconomic disadvantage, new research has revealed.

item.title: Comment: Military emissions must be reported
item.description: Emissions from the world’s armed forces must be counted and reported, argue Dr Oliver Heidrich and colleagues in a Comment article in Nature.

item.title: Comment: Jerry Lee Lewis
item.description: Writing for The Conversation, Dr Adam Behr discusses how Jerry Lee Lewis's fiery performances were inseparable from his reckless behaviour and dark personal life.

item.title: Business School awarded highest accreditation
item.description: Newcastle University Business School has been officially re-accredited by the European Quality Improvement System (EQUIS), one of the highest standard of achievement in business education.
